intro: Pterolepis pusilla, commonly known as the small-leaf pterolepis, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of southern Africa. It typically grows to a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters and features simple, alternate leaves that are usually lanceolate or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are borne on slender pedicels. Its flowering period generally occurs during the late spring to early summer months. Pterolepis pusilla is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
